meanings.definition: A complete body of laws or legal principles.
meanings.sent1: The pandect contains all the laws that we must follow.
meanings.sent2: She studied the pandect to understand the legal system better.
meanings.sent3: The pandect seemed like a never-ending list of rules to him.
meanings.sent4: In a world without the pandect, chaos would reign supreme.
meanings.sent5: The pandect was as thick as a brick, filled with legal knowledge.

meanings.definition: A comprehensive treatise or book covering a particular subject.
meanings.sent1: The pandect on astronomy explained the stars and planets in detail.
meanings.sent2: He referred to the pandect whenever he needed information on history.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the pandect around felt like having a library in his hands.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a pandect of knowledge, covering various topics.
meanings.sent5: The pandect was a treasure trove of information waiting to be explored.
